name: cruelly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 in an extremely unkind and unpleasant way: She was cruelly taunted by other kids. He was cruelly treated by his brothers, who sold him into slavery.
B2 in a way that causes great suffering: The disaster has cruelly exposed the gap between his rhetoric and the reality. The effects of global warming promise to be cruelly ironic. See
cruel
More examplesFewer examplesHe and his family had had to suffer cruelly at the hands of the enemy.The housing authority was cruelly indifferent to its tenants.It is a tragedy that her life has been so cruelly cut short.
